content:
Hi, thanks for this contribution! Here are a few suggestions to improve it:

[Goal]
- The second line "Split the ASCII string into lines at each /" feels redundant with the third line — consider removing it.
- "no visible characters" could be rephrased to "only whitespace characters (spaces and line breaks)" for clarity.

To @5DN1L and @User123
Thank you for your valuable feedback. We've taken it into consideration to create better Clash problems.

[Goal]

- Please remove the second line "Split the ASCII string into lines at each /." This instruction is already covered in more detail by the third line.

- Consider changing "no visible characters" to "only whitespace characters (spaces and line breaks)". Reference: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whitespace_character

[Input / Output]

- Please shift "Illegal output." from the Input section to the Output section.

[Constraints]

- Remove the line "If all output... 'Illegal output'.". This is a rule, not a constraint.

- Is there any reason why "/" cannot appear at the end of the final input line? You have a test case "Leading and trailing '/'" that allows for "/" to be the very first character, and you expect the output to contain a leading line break. This would make for a good edge case for a trailing "/" character also.

[Cases]

- Please refer to the case coverage comment by @YALOKGAR.

- Currently, the max n for all test cases is 20. Please add more test cases where n is much larger (consider 50, 75, 100), or consider revising your constraint instead.

- Please add a test case similar to Validator 4, where there is one (or more) trailing "/" character on one line and one (or more) leading "/" character on the next line.

- Please add a test case where the resulting output only contains spaces (and no line breaks).

Thank you.

| Test 2 and Validator 2 have identical structure (/ at end of line 1) consider varying
| Missing edge case input with only "/" characters

Goal
* Please correct the typo: "Sprit" => "Split".

* Please add:
Remove all the original line breaks, and replace each {{/}} by a line break.

Input
* [[i]] is undefined. Please change "The ith line" to "One line".

Output
* Please add "<<One or more lines:>>" before "The".

Constraints
* Please change the second constraint to:

0 ≤ length of a line of [[ASCII string]] ≤ 50

* Please add:
{{/}} never appears at the end of the final input line.

Stub generator
* Please change 10000 to 50.

Cases
* Please add a pair of cases whose input contains two or more blank lines and "/".

Thanks.
Empty output is not allowed. So, either avoid adding such cases, or require the player to produce a different output in those situations.

I agree with all of @User123's suggestions except for the one quoted in the next paragraph. Additionally, if the second suggestion (change "no visible characters") is adopted, please also remove the final part of the Goal section that lists the invisible characters.

> Is there any reason why "/" cannot appear at the end of the final input line? You have a test case "Leading and trailing '/'" that allows for "/" to be the very first character, and you expect the output to contain a leading line break. This would make for a good edge case for a trailing "/" character also.

I asked the author to add that constraint because trailing newlines are difficult to visualise in the case summary, and CG's handling of outputs with trailing newlines is unreliable (e.g. in the custom case field).
